source.description:

source.body: You can also split the 1x mastermix in half to reduce the volume down to 75 µl, if you just want to use 40 µl of DNA.

source.body: During this incubation take MinElute tubes out of the fridge so that they warm to room temperature before use in the next step. Purify the UDG-treated and blunt-end repaired DNA with a MinElute kit, with the following modifications to the manufacturer's protocol.

Pre-heat elution buffer EBT to
.

For each reaction, add
PB (binding) buffer to a new 1.5 ml LoBind tube and add the UDG-treated and blunt end repaired sample, then vortex briefly to mix.

Load each reaction (PB buffer + sample) onto a MinElute column and incubate at RT for
.

source.body: This allows sufficient time for the DNA to bind to the silica membrane.

source.description:
Spin
and discard flow-through.

source.body:
Discard flow-through in one of two following ways:
  • Remove all liquid in the collection tube with a pipette, or
  • Pour off the liquid into a fresh waste tube, and pat the rim of the collection tube dry on a paper tissue or towel. Use just one spot on the paper tissue per sample. Be careful not to touch the rim of the tube on the waste container. After you are finished with all samples, discard the paper and wipe clean the surface underneath with water and then sterilize the surface with bleach (or DNA Away).
During cleaning of surfaces after flow-through discard, do NOT apply bleach before first cleaning with water. Residual GuHCl will react with bleach to form toxic gases.

source.description:
Add
PE (wash) buffer to the MinElute column.

Spin at
and discard flow-through as in step 5.4.

Dry spin for
.

Flip columns 180° and dry spin again for
.
Remove columns from their collection tubes and place them in new labeled 1.5 ml LoBind tubes.

Add
pre-heated EBT to the column, let stand for
then spin
to elute.

source.body:
Carefully pipette EBT directly onto the center of the membrane without touching the membrane.
Optional: In case the library preparation can not be done in one day, this is a good point to pause the protocol. Freeze samples at for up to two weeks until continuation.

source.description:
Prepare a mastermix for adapter ligation calculating
. Use a 1.5 ml LoBind tube to set up the ligation mastermix.
ABCD
1ReagentStock concentrationFinal concentration1 x Volume [µl]
2Quick Ligase Buffer2 x1 x20
3Adapter Mix10 µM0.25 µM1
4Eluate from Step 5.1018
5Total40

source.body: The mastermix is calculated to accommodate addition of Quick Ligase to each reaction individually after aliquotting to individual reaction tubes.

source.description:
ABCD
1ReagentStock concentrationFinal concentration1 x Volume [µl]
2Quick Ligase Buffer2 x1 x20
3Adapter Mix10 µM0.25 µM1

5Total40

Aliquot
of mastermix to each tube (use 0.2 ml PCR strips). Transfer the complete eluate (step 5.10) (~
) per sample to each new tube.

source.body: Alternatively, if you have a heat block available, you can add the mastermix to the eluate directly in the 1.5 ml tubes from the elution step without transferring it into 0.2 ml PCR strips. For purification after ligation you can then also add the PB-Buffer into these tubes (step 9.2).

source.description:
Then add
of Quick Ligase (
stock,
final concentration) to each library sample. Mix by flicking the tubes and spin down.

source.body: Make sure to add the full volume of ligase by pipetting up and down several times to get all of it off the walls of the pipette tip.

for
in the thermocycler.

source.body: During this incubation take MinElute tubes out of the fridge so that they warm to room temperature before use in the next step. Also label two sets of 1.5 ml LoBind tubes and 0.2 ml PCR tubes per sample for the next steps. At this time you can also add the PB-Buffer (650µl) to one set of 1.5 ml LoBind tubes for Step 9.2.

.

For each sample, add
PB buffer to a new 1.5 ml LoBind tube and add the entire volume of the adapter ligation mix, then vortex briefly.

Load each reaction (PB buffer + adapter-ligated library) onto a MinElute column and incubate for
.

source.body: This allows the DNA sufficient time to bind to the silica membrane.

source.body: During this incubation label new 0.2 ml tubes for step 12 and new 1.5 ml LoBind tubes for step 13.

source.description:
Aliquot
water to the 0.2 ml PCR tubes. Aliquot
per library to 0.2 ml PCR tubes with 18 uL water (making a 1:10 dilution of the library) for the qPCR quality check (steps 15-16).

Transfer the remaining ~
of the final library to a fresh 1.5 ml LoBind tube.

Freeze the library at
without purification until further processing.

Prepare a qPCR assay calculating
. Prepare 2 reactions per sample, plus 16 additional reactions for 7 qPCR standards in duplicates and 2 qPCR blanks. This qPCR uses a 1:10 dilution of the samples.
ABCD
1ReagentStock concentrationFinal concentration1 x Volume [µl]
2DyNAmo MasterMix2 x1 x10
3IS7 primer10 µM1 µM1
4IS8 primer10 µM1 µM1
5HPLC-Water (non UVed)7
6DNA or HPLC-Water (1:10 dilution)1
7Total20

source.body: The 1:10 dilutions of the samples are prepared in the cleanroom, but the qPCR is performed in the modern lab.

source.description:
ABCD
1ReagentStock concentrationFinal concentration1 x Volume [µl]
2DyNAmo MasterMix2 x1 x10
3IS7 primer10 µM1 µM1
4IS8 primer10 µM1 µM1
5HPLC-Water (non UVed)7
6DNA or HPLC-Water (1:10 dilution)1
7Total20

source.body:
**Important**
Do NOT vortex the DyNAmo mastermix, it will create bubbles that are nearly impossible to remove. The bubbles will interfere with the qPCR measurements. Gently pipette the DyNAmo mastermix to equally distribute the fluorescent dye.
Gently pipette the qPCR mastermix, or gently invert the tube several times to mix. Again avoid creating any bubbles.

source.description:
Add
mastermix and
1:10 diluted libraries, standard, or water to a fresh 96-well qPCR plate. Seal with adhesive clear qPCR seal sheets and briefly spin down.

source.body: Be sure to check that the reactions do not contain bubbles, because this will affect the qPCR readings and subsequent downstream calculations. If bubbles are present, briefly centrifuge the plate at maximum speed to remove them.

source.description:
Amplify the qPCR reactions with the following program:
ABC
1TemperatureTime
295°C10 minInital denaturation
395°C30 sec40 cycles
460°C1 min
572°C30 sec
660-95˚CMelting curve
7Finally hold the reactions at 37°C.

ABC
1TemperatureTime
295°C10 minInital denaturation
395°C30 sec40 cycles
460°C1 min
572°C30 sec
660-95˚CMelting curve
7Finally hold the reactions at 37°C.

source.body: The number of DNA copies determined with this qPCR is used to determine the amount of sample used as input for indexing protocols.

materials.name: FrameStar® 96 Well Semi-Skirted PCR Plate Roche Style
DyNAmo Flash sYBR Green qPCR Kit

description:
Protocol for the preparation of double-stranded genomic libraries for Illumina sequencing, optimised for ancient DNA (aDNA) with initial USER enzyme treatment. This protocol generates adapter ligated DNA fragments that can be used in conjunction with downstream indexing protocols.
The initial treatment with UDG (USER) removes molecular 'damage' in the form of deaminated cytosines characteristic of aDNA. This protocol is modified after Meyer & Kircher (2010) Cold Spring Harb. Protoc. (doi: 10.1101/pdb.prot5448) and Briggs et al. (2010) Nucleic Acids Research 38 (6) (doi: 10.1093/nar/gkp1163)
